articles.title: Kim Yong Nam greets Bulgarian President
Greetings to Bulgarian prime minister
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam greets Bulgarian President 
    Pyongyang, March 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, yesterday sent a message of greetings to Bulgarian President Georgi Parvanov on the occasion of the national day.
 The message extended warm congratulations to the president, the government and the people of Bulgaria.   
 In the belief that the relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms in the interests of the two peoples, it wished the president and people of Bulgaria success in their efforts for prosperity of the country, economic stability and admittance to the EU.

articles.content:
Greetings to Bulgarian prime minister 
    Pyongyang, March 4 (KCNA) -- Premier Hong Song Nam of the DPRK cabinet sent a message of greetings to Bulgarian prime minister Simeon Borisov Sakskoburggotski on the occasion of the national day.
 Extending warm congratulations to the prime minister, the government and the people of Bulgaria, the message wished him greater success in his responsible work for economic development of the country.    
 Meanwhile, foreign minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to his Bulgarian counterpart Solomon Isak Pasi.

Kim Yong Nam leaves Bangkok 
    Bangkok, March 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, left Bangkok today by a special plane after winding up his 4-day official goodwill visit to the Kingdom of Thailand.
 He and his entourage were seen off at the airport by deputy prime minister and minister of defence of Thailand Chavalith Yonchaiyudh, officials concerned, the DPRK ambassador to Thailand and embassy officials.    
 They were shown round the grand palace in Bangkok and other places during their stay in Thailand.

articles.content:
Message of thanks to Thai prime minister
    Bangkok, March 3 (KCNA) -- President Kim Yong Nam of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly today sent a message of thanks to Thai prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra on leaving Thailand.
 He in the message sincerely thanked the government, the people and the prime minister of Thailand for their warm welcome and exceptional hospitality extended to them during their stay, and expressed conviction that the friendly relations and cooperation between the two countries would further strengthen and develop in the interests of the two peoples.    
 He wholeheartedly wished the prime minister good health and happiness as well as greater successes in his responsible work for the economic development and social progress. He also wished for the welfare and prosperity of the friendly Thai people.
